wiki.content:
Boy is a Swiss-German pop duo founded in 2007 by singer Valeska Steiner and bassist Sonja Glass. The two met while at a pop-music course at the Hochschule für Musik und Theater Hamburg in 2005.
 [1] The band initially played concerts exclusively,
 [2] before being discovered and signed to Herbert Grönemeyer's label, Grönland Records, in 2011.
 [3]Their debut album, Mutual Friends was produced by Philip Steinke and released in the autumn of 2011.
 [1]
  The band sings entirely in English in a style reminiscent of that of Leslie Feist.
 [2][4]
 Boy won the Hamburg Musician Prize HANS in 2011 in the category Hamburgs Newcomer of the Year, and their album Mutual Friends won the 2012 European Border Breakers Award (EBBA).
 [5][6]
 The duo's song "Little Numbers" was also featured in the Lufthansa Airline's Business Class advertisement in mid 2012.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
